reviewText: OMG where to begin... Zane is amazing this collection left me wanting more, the characters were amazing the scenes were awesome and I was very excited about the way everything played out it definately left you craving season two, and i cant wait for the release of that dvd as well... keep up the great work Zane.
More details than I thought there would be.  I don't have Cinemax, so I bought this series.

Zane's Sex Chronicles is based on the books by author Zane. The show stars Patrice Fisher, who plays Patience James. A succesful business woman who moonlights as an erotic writer under the name Zane while struggling to find that "one." She eventually does find him in the form of Hunter (played by Ezra 'Buddha' Masters) but will her secret life break them apart?

Meanwhile, her friends are going through trials of love of their own. Maricruz (played by Joanna Quintero) plays a divorcee who is still in love with her ex-husband but wants to branch out and find her own sexuality. This road leads her to fall in love with a handsome beau named Charles (played by Jeff Pickel)  but he has his own dark secret which leads to a collision course with Maricruz' ex-husband.

Lyric (played by Maya Gilbert) is married and both she and her husband (played by Damian T. Raven) are succesful doctors but the action at home is anything but hot. This leads Lyric to contemplate an affair with a co-worker but the results could cost her her marriage.

Laila Odom plays Ana. A budding stand up comedian who's constant affairs on her boyfriend Tarriq (played by Amin Joseph) may end up sabatoging her relationship.

Eboni (played by Christina DeRosa) runs a gym but may lose it due to a lack of money. She makes a deal to get a loan but gets in over her head. Meanwhile she meets a man that she fall in love with but he's made a vow of celebacy. This creates a problem for Eboni as she isn't sure she can wait for marriage for sex.

Overall, this trip down erotica is smartly written and tastefully done. Plus, for me personally, seeing African-American women (in this case, Patrice, Maya & Lyric) in this way is rather refreshing rather than just pure base sex. They have real characters and act like real people, not just walking female horny toads! I also like they mix up the women (racially) unlike most shows similiar to this like "Sex & The City" or the comedies "Friends" or "Living Single" with Johanna (who is hispanic) and Christina (who is Italian). Granted, only Sex & The City is even close to a comparison to this but living in a city like that, what are the chances of going somewhere where there is only one racial group? Zane's portrayal of this landscape is more realistic in my view.

While I wouldn't consider this a must buy, its definitely worth the money in my view. Its one of those, you either like it or you don't. Its a good series to me.

Zane Season One is great.  Season Two had a few good episodes but overall it just wasn't a good follow-up to Season One. The premiere of Zane's Sex Chronicles was a welcomed departure from all the other cable soft-porn shows that don't cast black actors.  This is why Season Two was so disappointing.  I watch Zane to see people of color. It appears in Season Two they tried to appeal to a white audience as evidenced by the numerous scenes in which they were cast.

A note to Zane's creator, director and producer: Don't change trying to find an audience, the audience will find you.

Let me note two trends in thinking about this erotic series.  First, most softcore that you see on cable stations is entirely white.  Second, if you visit the blue-movie section of any video store, you will find DVDs with only white couples, those with only Black couples, or those with only interracial couples.

This Zane series is daring by bringing Black people into this softcore genre.  Is the series trying to do what "The Cosby Show" did for sitcoms in the 1980s?  Is it possible for softcore to have a multi-ethnic and large audience?

My point in bringing up blue-movie places is that viewers, for the most part, want to see one type of couple, and only that type, when they are renting.  This Zane series is so diverse that you never know what the composition of the next couple to get busy will be.  Each episode that I've seen has shown some Black nudity and some white nudity in an unpredictable order.  So you have to love the smorgasbord: you have to be cool with all body colors and freaky combos when watching this show.  This show pushes the envelopes in many ways.  If you only like seeing one type of couple, then this is not for you.  You have to like everything on the platter in order to get into this series.

This series is for the open-minded and the sex-positive.  I enjoy how it is exploring unconventional territory.  I hope the squeamish or narrow-minded will consider the voyage that this series wants you to take.
